result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry A. Schwister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs paid in full.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry A. Schwister

records.addlTxt: 14CF172, 14CM366, 14CF208, 15TR33 & 15TR34 cases called at 11:54 am. Defendant Jerry A. Schwister in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record. Preliminary hearing addressed on 14CF208-Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing-finds probable cause and enters an order for bind over for trial. Information filed. Plea entered.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 14CF172 & No Contest to Count 1 of 14CF208. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 14CF172, Count 2 of 14CF208, 14CM366, 15TR33 & 15TR34. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Wallace. Statement by the defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS on COUNT 1 of 14CF172 - 5 months WCJ, with Huber. No Good Time Credit. Credit for 10 days served. To begin no later than July 5, 2015. CONDITIONS ON BOTH CASES:  Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid withihn 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied. Defendant to provide a DNA Sample Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 05-29-2015 11:30 am

Case Called @ 1:14 PM: Defendant Jerry A. Schwister in court with attorney Colleen Bradley, both appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  DA argues as to cash bond of at least $1000.00.  Unknown of any decision in Wood Co charging as of today's bond hearing.  Argument as to bond by SPD - Def has no ability to post large cash bond.  The Court:  Cash Bond ordered w/conditions.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  SPD confirms that Atty Wallace will be appointed on this matter also.  STC Scheduled w/pending matters.  Status conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 03:50 pm.
